channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: The future of tourism in the coronavirus era: Does Asia have the answers?
item.description: It's a sunny day on Bangkok's most famous tourist street, and shopkeeper Cletana Thangworachai is open for business.

item.title: White House Covid cases contradict Trump's message on opening
item.description: The White House Covid-19 outbreak is undermining President Donald Trump's narrative that it's safe to open up the country and that diagnostic testing is of limited importance.

item.title: Pence will not self-quarantine and plans to be at the White House Monday
Renewed outbreaks in China and South Korea show risk of reopening
item.description: "It's not over until it's over."

item.title: India to partially resume passenger train services amid nationwide lockdown
Boris Johnson calls on UK to go back to work
item.description: From Wednesday, people in the UK will be able to sunbathe in their local parks, exercise as much as they want and drive to other destinations, Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced Sunday, as he laid out his vision for gradually restarting the economy.

item.title: Watch Boris Johnson ease up on some coronavirus restrictions
item.description: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson laid out his vision for gradually restarting the economy, calling on people across the United Kingdom to return to work if they cannot do so from home. CNN's Max Foster reports.

item.title: South Dakota Sioux tribe refuses to take down checkpoints that governor says are illegal
item.description: The Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe in South Dakota is refusing to end coronavirus checkpoints declared illegal by the state's governor, saying they are the best tool they have to stop the virus from spreading.

item.title: How the coronavirus collapse could break Trump
item.description: The last time an incumbent president lost re-election -- George H.W. Bush, in 1992 -- an "it's the economy, stupid" campaign theme took him down. Unemployment then was hovering around 7.5%.

item.title: Video appears to show Ahmaud Arbery at construction site before shooting, family lawyer says
Princeton names its first black valedictorian in the university's history
item.description: Princeton University has named its first black valedictorian in the school's 274-year history.

item.title: Airlines say massive job cuts are coming
item.description: US airline workers have been largely spared from the carnage that's pushed the country's unemployment to record highs since the start of the coronavirus pandemic. But those same workers -— roughly 750,000 pilots, flight attendants, baggage handlers, mechanics and others — will soon be among the most at-risk for losing their jobs.

item.title: Analysis: As top advisers go into quarantine, Trump seems focused on voter fraud
R&B loses three legends
item.description: It was a tough weekend for rhythm and blues with the deaths of three musical icons.

item.title: Little Richard, pianist, entertainer and Rock 'n' Roll legend, dies
item.description: Pianist, entertainer and Rock 'n' Roll legend Little Richard has died, Dick Alen, the entertainer's former agent confirms to CNN.

item.title: Tapper to Trump adviser: Here's what governors tell me
item.description: CNN's Jake Tapper tells White House adviser Kevin Hassett that governors want President Donald Trump to invoke the Defense Production Act so states can have access to critical supplies to fight the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: 'Stunning': Clinton cabinet member reacts to Trump's no-mask meeting
item.description: Lawrence Summers, who served in the Obama and Clinton administrations, reacts to photos showing President Donald Trump's meeting with military leaders. No one in the photos was wearing a face mask, following announcements that the CDC director, FDA commissioner and Dr. Anthony Fauci are taking various measures to quarantine after being exposed to a person at the White House who tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Lebanon reverses decision to ease virus measures after increase in cases
Pence will not self-quarantine and plans to be at the White House Monday
item.description: Vice President Mike Pence is not planning to enter self-quarantine after his press secretary tested positive for coronavirus on Friday and plans to be at the White House on Monday, a Pence spokesperson said on Sunday.

item.title: A cluster of coronavirus cases in California was traced to a coughing patient at a birthday party
item.description: A birthday party was behind a cluster of coronavirus cases in Pasadena, California, according to health officials.

item.title: The Indian revolutionary who fought to overthrow British rule while living in Japan
Bono celebrates 60th birthday by sharing playlist of 60 songs that saved his life
item.description: Millions of fans turned their attention to Bono on Sunday as they helped wish him a happy 60th birthday, but the U2 frontman took the day to thank the 60 artists who made him the musician he is today by releasing a playlist of "60 Songs That Saved My Life."

item.title: The mysterious illness that could be linked to coronavirus in children
item.description: A mysterious illness that's affecting children and could be linked to the coronavirus has left officials alarmed and searching for answers as infections increase.

item.title: Photo shows Katie Miller speaking to press day before testing positive
item.description: President Trump divulged that Katie Miller, the vice president's press secretary and wife of Trump adviser Stephen Miller, has tested positive for the coronavirus.

item.title: Cluster of Covid-19 cases linked to California birthday party
item.description: A birthday party in March was behind a cluster of coronavirus cases in Pasadena, California, according to health officials. CNN's Paul Vercammen has more.

item.title: Quick-thinking off-duty officer saves US hiker from whirlpool
item.description: A quick-thinking off-duty officer helped save a 24-year-old hiker who was trapped in a whirlpool on Saturday.

item.title: Remains of 25 people found in mass grave in Mexico's Jalisco state
item.description: Law enforcement in Mexico's Jalisco state discovered a mass grave with the bodies of at least 25 unidentified people, the prosecutor's office in that state said.

item.title: After an officer was spat on, a UK resident made 200 face shields to protect police
item.description: Residents in the UK stepped up to help protect police on the frontlines of the coronavirus pandemic after an officer was spat on.

item.title: Ice cream shop closes one day after reopening because customers didn't follow social distancing rules
item.description: Nearly all states partially reopened last week and businesses across the country are preparing to welcome customers back. But because of the coronavirus pandemic, things are far from normal.

item.title: Fact-checking five of Trump's false claims this week
item.description: CNN's Daniel Dale fact-checks five of President Donald Trump's claims this week, from falsely saying the Obama administration left him broken coronavirus tests to promising he'll always protect health care plans for people with pre-existing conditions.

item.title: Elon Musk threatens to move Tesla headquarters out of California
item.description: In a series of tweets Saturday, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said he would file a lawsuit "immediately" against Alameda County, California, after the county refused to let the company reopen its Fremont factory. He then threatened to move the company's headquarters to Texas or Nevada, where shelter-in-place rules are less restrictive.

item.title: US health officials warn against Mother's Day gatherings while coronavirus death toll nears 79,000
item.description: Health officials across the country are warning Americans to refrain from celebrating Mother's Day in large crowds this year, urging that continued social distancing is still key to preventing more coronavirus cases.

item.title: Coronavirus leaves the Gulf's migrant workers in limbo, with no income and no easy way out
item.description: Six Indian workers lie in bunk beds in the middle of a workday. Beyond the four walls of their small room in the United Arab Emirates, their options for maintaining a livelihood are becoming increasingly slim.

item.title: Why does Bollywood use the offensive practice of brownface in movies?
item.description: Bollywood may be best known for its glamorous casts, glitzy costumes and energetic dance routines. But it also has a far less flattering reputation -- for promoting the offensive practice of brownface.

item.title: Beaches are going 'business class' this summer
item.description: You make reservations at restaurants, sure. But how about booking in advance just to get a spot on the sand at the beach?

item.title: Last Nazi message decoded by Britain revealed on VE Day anniversary
item.description: The last recorded Nazi message intercepted and decoded by Britain in World War II has been revealed for the first time to mark the 75th anniversary of Victory in Europe (VE) Day.

item.title: In 2020, masks aren't just for protection -- they're being used to make a statement
item.description: Cowboy boots used to be Sebastian Marquardt's go-to fashion item. He'd wear them everywhere in his neighborhood of Hamburg, Germany. He liked that the black, pointy shoes -- more common in parts of the US -- stood out.

item.title: Ballerinas from all over the world created a mesmerizing video to raise money for other dancers' coronavirus relief
item.description: Leading ballerinas from countries across the world have come together in a stunning performance to raise money for dancers facing financial difficulties due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Mother's Day messages from CNN's Wolf Blitzer, Dr. Sanjay Gupta and more
item.description: Sunday is Mother's Day, and CNN anchors -- including Christiane Amanpour, Brooke Baldwin, Wolf Blitzer, Ana Cabrera, Clarissa Ward, Dr. Sanjay Gupta, Don Lemon, Brian Stelter and Bill Weir -- share their tributes to the women in their lives.

item.title: The world is paying a high price for cheap clothes
item.description: When shoppers entered H&M's flagship store in central London last summer, the first thing they would have seen was a dark blue, flowery minidress hanging front and center. On sale for just £4 (or $4.80 US), the dress featured more than a low price tag. It also boasted a green label with the word "CONSCIOUS."

item.title: A short biography in 9 cross-country trips
item.description: I've crossed America, by land, nine times so far. Once by a series of buses, twice by train and the rest driving.

item.title: This is how Mother's Day was born
item.description: It's time to celebrate the person who brought you into this world.

item.title: Infections on rise in Germany days after restrictions eased
As virus draws closer to him, Trump turns to 2020 and stokes fears about voter fraud
item.description: As President Donald Trump has tried to move past the pandemic, it edged even closer into his inner circle of advisers Saturday with news that top members of the coronavirus task force will self-quarantine, in some form, after coming in contact with an individual who tested positive for the virus.

item.title: How pandemic is affecting people's drinking habits
item.description: Isolation, boredom and anxiety can lead to more drinking by "problem drinkers" in the UK, a new study shows. CNN's Nina dos Santos explores how the coronavirus pandemic lockdown is affecting people's drinking habits.

item.title: The Indian revolutionary who fought to overthrow British rule -- from Japan
Rare blue dragons are washing up on the Padre Island National Seashore
item.description: Here be dragons -- literally.

item.title: 26-year-old surfer killed in shark attack
item.description: A 26-year-old man was killed in a shark attack while surfing at a Northern California beach Saturday afternoon, according to the California Department of Parks and Recreation.

item.title: Why aren't editorial boards screaming: Trump has to go?
item.description: By the height of the Watergate scandal in 1974, virtually every major newspaper in America had called for President Richard Nixon's resignation. During the investigation and impeachment of Bill Clinton in 1998, more than 100 newspapers called for him to resign.
